author: Lucyvp
title: GP Appointments
body:
I have been going through various treatments and tests for some time, for a number of different matters. I received a text message on Friday asking me to make an appointment to speak to the GP.  
I have spent almost an hour trying to get into the queue for an appointment, followed by a further hour on the phone, in the queue, only to discover the practice is closed and has not set up their phone service as such. This kind of wait is typical and the phone triage system is a nightmare.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: rgpie38
title: Very efficient & person friendly
body:
I fell in the street at the weekend and an ambulance was called. They had trouble locating me due the area where the fall happened but the paramedics came quite quickly and the 2 paramedics and a trainee did everything they were supposed to do and then advised I go to the Queen Elizabeth Hospital to be checked out.  
At the Minor injury clinic I was given good care and attention. I was first seen by a health care assistant who made me comfortable on the bed and the the nurse practitioner Elaine was excellent, very efficient and she was clearly a people person.  
Overall I was very impressed.

author: violetfw33
title: My mum
body: I'd just like to say thank you to all staff in ward 10 who looked after my mum sadly she passed away but cant say thank you enough especially the two nurses who were with her in her passing as we were just to late getting there you are all a credit to the nhs again thank you so much

author: scutumzs86
title: stay in C.A.U
body: I would like to thank the Doctor's and Nurses for there kind care and service whilst I was in C. A. U and ward 3e. They gave me the best care and attention during my stay. The NHS can hold there head up high for the wonderful job they do. God Bless.

author: Cdinsy
title: Visit to a and e
body:
I just wanted to highlight the excellent service my son received today when he was referred to a and e via NHS 24.. from the reception staff triage nurse doctor and the radiographers assistant they were all excellent. He was treated with total dignity and respect with a particularly delicate presenting complaint.  
Thank you

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Shocking incompetence
body:
Since covid and not being able to GET to the desk the level of incompetence has gone through the roof. 
My wife's letter that she was told was there that day and done , by the evening it didn't exist. 
I put a prescription for 6 items some fairly urgent a week later from the front door to the desk was lost . Then they found it !
But gave me 6 items from a previous request leaving me without medication .
Now today when I get through after 48 attempts I tell them of 2 major problems of extra bone sticking into my throat and my increased balance issues .
Told doctor would ring me .
Yes you guessed it , nothing .
Phoned 12 more times before 1 PM only got answer machine. 
If theres no patients , WHAT are the 2 receptionists doing??
I honestly believe 1 off them is showing signs of dementia. 
I'd like to think they would read this and respond , but I'm not holding my breath.

title: Hard to visit patients.
body: Needed to take fresh clothes and retrieve dirty ones. Visits must only be by pre scheduled appointments. Unnecessary poor procedure. Hope patient is getting good treatment and can soon come home. Not convenient for patient or visitors. Why is this necessary?

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Flu Vaccination
body: I visited the surgery 26th September for my flu vaccination. I arrive 15minutes early. I went straight in. The organisation, and efficiency, was brilliant. I was in, and out within about 2minutes. I was very, very impressed, with the speed and safety.

title: Good practice
body: Saw my own doctor and everything was fine. She reassured me about the problem that I was worried about, and I am very happy about that.

title: Good practice
body:
Had flu jab, very effecient, was booked in for jab at 12.25 mrs at 12.30! We were in & out before 12
30! Very good!

title: Excellent patient care
body: I had the need to speak to a doctor- the doctor called me ta the appointed time. Was very professional and caring. After a telephone  consultation I asked to come in and see the doctor face to face. Again I was dealt with in a professional manner. The reception staff are always very helpful  both on the telephone and when you need to speak to them face to face. I am very grateful to all the staff.

author: New-mummy
title: Maternity care
body:
I just wanted to say the biggest thank you to every member of staff that cared for me before and after giving birth to my baby girl in the maternity unit at RAH Paisley. I was admitted to the maternity ward on the Friday evening to start the process of induction. After receiving 3 pessaries, I was finally able to have my waters broken on the labour ward. Thank you to Paula and Laura who seen me through the induction process!  
The main midwifes that helped me through the labour and birth were Jackie and Kenny and I honestly cannot thank them enough. They were both so calm and caring, nothing was a problem and you could just tell how passionate and experienced they were in their roles. Everything went well with the labour and birth and then I unfortunately suffered a PPH just after the birth. Again, the doctor and the rest of the team that came to assist the midwifes were just incredible. Even in such an emergency situation everyone remained so calm and in control which was so reassuring for my husband and I. Once the haemorrhage was under control, the room was cleaned up within minutes and you would never have known such an event had ever happened! The next day I received a blood transfusion and my midwife was Justine. Again, she was just amazing and looked after me so well all day until I was ready to go back up to the post natal ward. I know my husband was ever so grateful to all the staff as well! All was well with my baby girl and I and we were discharged from the hospital the next day. Unfortunately we did have to return for a couple of nights due to my baby developing jaundice but once again, the staff were just amazing and helped me through this small hiccup! Again, a massive thank you to each and every member of staff that I met on the ward, I am so so grateful to every one of you, what an incredible team of staff! Some of the other names I can remember were Denise, Rachel and Lauren, I know there was more but I cannot remember their names! Thank you to you all! We are now at home and loving life as a family of 3, our baby girl is doing amazing!  
I would also like to say a massive thank you to my amazing midwife that seen me through my pregnancy journey in my home area in Oban - Elayne. I am so lucky to have had your support throughout, nothing was every a problem and you were always there to answer my questions and keep me right! Once again, absolutely amazing service that I cannot thank you for enough!

title: Great practice
body: It was amazing how the practice was organised for the flu vaccine with so many people. It was like clockwork . In and out without people waiting around . Despite the hard work, the nurses still managed to smile . Fantastic . Thank you .

title: Brilliant organization of flu vaccinations
body: We were dreading attending this years flu vaccination clinic but the organization and attention to detail for a streamlined and COVID-19 secure delivery of injections was outstanding. It must have taken less than 2 mins, keeping socially distanced, to be assessed, with questions about any possible COVID contacts or symptoms, temperature checked, hands sanitized, directed along a one-way corridor to the door of an examination room, arm exposed and injected, surrendered bar-coded clinic letter and exiting the building. Well done everyone involved x

title: Fantastic Practice
body: Very professional, everything was well organized from start to finish. Car parking and marshalls did an excellent job. The nursing staff were very professional, friendly and made us feel at ease in these difficult times. Thank you everyone you are amazing.

title: Exceptional care from all
body:
:
I took my 86 year old Dad to the minor injury unit at The New QE2 WGC yesterday 26/09/20 Following a fall and injury to his wrist and received exceptional care. From the security man on the door who welcomed us with a cheerful smile and told us where to stand, to the helpful and cheerful reception staff, the nurse who did his obs, the ENP who examined and advised And treated and the radiologist who did his X-ray. Each and everyone of them made us feel that we were in safe hands and being well cared for every step of the way. Thank you to everyone of them for making a scary process ( heâ€™d not been a patient for over 20 years!) as calm and normal as possible.

title: Very efficient local practice
body: I have always been very happy with the treatment I have received at the practice and have been a patient for over 30 years. Everyone is always friendly and efficient and the doctors are very caring.

title: Good practice
body: Went in on time for my flu jab and found all to be very efficient and professional. No problem at all. Very good service

title: Well organised
body: The flu clinic I attended was very well organised and run social distancing was in full operation and hand sanitizer were available to use and encouraged, could Not fault the staff very friendly and professional.

title: EXCELLENT 65+ FLU JAB SERVICE AT SUNDAY CLINIC
body: All aspects were great..from receipt of invite letter..through to professional, efficient  and covid-safe vaccination on the day.  Feel grateful to have had this service so early in the season, especially as many people have to wait. My thanks  to the staff for giving up their Sundays.

title: Good practice
body: I went to surgery for flu vaccine.It was very well organised. I was quickly directed to the nurse who gave me vaccine and was done quickly with a smile. All the staff were very polite and had a smile on their face. Well done.

title: Friendly practice
body: The flu clinic was well organised and ran smoothly and efficiently. All the staff were helpful kind and considerate

author: E F
title: Hospital admission
body: I had a very positive experience in ward 14 and ward 15 at University Hospital Wishaw, Wishaw within NHS Lanarkshire. The nursing and medical staff were excellent especially Gillian, Karen the domestic and Rachel. Eilish the OT was also very good.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Gone badly down hill
body: I recently had a back burn, which was treated was treated at the Cumberland centre ( they have been great) this was retreated by them on three occasions. Then they asked me to go through my doctors friary house when I called I was told there wasn't an appointment that week or even the next, I called the Cumberland and they agreed to treat me again,after sending an email to the practice manager I got a call to say I had to be referred to mount Gould, then received a call from them to ask me if I was house bond ,which I'm not, they said that this had been happening a lot and that they would email the g p back,this still leaves me with a bad burn that needs treatment.  I don't think a sticking plaster will do .

title: flu jab
body: Very fast efficient experience. Would definitely recommend this practice to friends and family. Always received good friendly helpful service

author: Safetyconcern
title: Care of my gran
body:
My Gran tested positive for covid-19 when she was admitted to hospital. We understand that this means she is unable to have visitors however, because of this we feel we have no evidence that she is being well cared for.  
We were asked by the ward to bring in clothes and toiletries, but we did not get a bag of belongings back for washing. We were told that she fell from the bed and had to have an xray, thankfully nothing was broken. The information given from the ward was that she "shimmied to the bottom of the bed and fell out." My gran has dementia, but has lived a sedentary lifestyle for the last 20 years, for the last 2 years I have not seen her move unprompted by a carer or relative, so the idea of her "shimmying" sounds very far fetched in my Opinion. If my gran had fallen as the bed sides were not used properly, I would be happy to accept that this sometimes happens, instead, I feel we don't know the full picture.  
My gran was admitted before and we felt we had to submit a complaint as she had been left on a bedpan for more that 30 minutes and the buzzer was ringing for a further 20 minutes before a member of staff came to help (even though I heard them in the staff area discussing personal matters).  
We need reassurance that she is being well cared for as we cannot see for ourselves and she can't communicate effectively with us as she struggles with her memory.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Grateful of Edinbane
title: Treatment at Portree minor injuries unit
body: I had a fall yesterday and damaged my face.   Within   40 minutes of phoning I was seen by Simon, a paramedic, who reviewed me, patched me up and sent me on my way. Given it takes 25 minutes to drive to Portree this was amazing service. Thank you so much; great service.

title: Great Practice
body: I went in for a flu jab on a Sunday & it was all very organized, staff was very friendly & the whole process was very quick. I was very satisfied

title: Phenomenal care at St. Mary's Birth Centre
body:
There are no words to describe the wonderful personal care, support and attention given to me from the midwives at St. Mary's Birth Centre at the time of my labour. 
My positive birth experience was entirely down to the midwives in this unit. Although I was having my first baby, I felt so relaxed in their hands and put my full trust in their experience and knowledge. They were sensitive to my Birth Plan preferences, and filled me with confidence that everything would go well during my most vulnerable moments. I was keen to have a water birth so, when the Birthing Pool was occupied during my labour, both the ensuite bath tub in my Birth Centre room and the Labour Ward Birthing pool were prepared for me. The midwives did everything they could to facilitate this wish, and it was indeed the ensuite bathtub that was used in the end.
I have been so inspired, that I will be finding ways to support St. Mary's Birth Centre in the future, through voluntary roles or even midwife training myself.
I hope it will be possible to return to the unit again, should I need to give birth. And I very much hope the same angel midwives will be there!

title: Brilliant Practice/ excellent care
body: I completed a non urgent online request yesterday morning as needed some medical advice. Although as advised on the website that I may have to wait for up to three days for a reply, I had a call within a few hours, have followed the advise given and problem sorted! Thank you to the lovely Dr who phoned me and to all at  Belmont surgery. AB

title: Thank you
body: Thank you for looking after my father who very sadly passed away in your HDU unit. He couldnâ€™t write this review himself, but he would have wanted to. You had such patience with him and were so caring to him while we couldnâ€™t be there in his last days due to coronavirus. You were great at communicating with us. I am so upset about my dads death, but am grateful for the time you took to talk to us after he had died and the care you provided before and after he died. Thank you. I wish we could have seen him and been told to come in earlier, that is the only thing that has really upset me, but he died very suddenly so I understand.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Efficient service
body: The service for the flu vaccinations was quick, easy and efficient. The staff were pleasant and professional.

title: Caring & systematic practice
body: Short & sweet, better then expected even. I aarrived and was seenwithin 5 minutes. Social distancing was well managed.

title: Good service
body: My appointment was for my Annual flu jab - it was a very professional and well organised service.  Staff very helpful and friendly and informative. The whole experience was well planned and executed.

title: Such helpful and understanding sessions
body: A bit of background of my mental illness before I get started. I suffered a miscarriage between having my first and second child which left me very sad, lost and very anxious, said feelings of anxiousness and lots of intrusive thoughts led me to develop generalised anxiety and my doctor refereed me to the healthy minds team. I was a little skeptical at first, as I wasn't too sure the CBT Therapy would help me, but I was very much mistaken. I have benefited so much from their help. Due to covid I didn't have any face to face sessions, just telephone sessions. These were so good, I felt I was listened to and my therapists was so understanding and non judgemental with all my worries and silly thoughts. This really made me feel like I was being cared for. I looked forward to my weekly sessions so much, and the modules I was given to work through and the tips and advice I recieved have helped me really understand myself better and know that it's okay to have mental health issues. I've just finished my course of therapy and it's really been such a godsend and put me on such a stronger path then I was on before. I'm very grateful to have been offered this service, and would very much recommend it, if your suffering with any mental health issues yourself.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Flu jab
body: Brilliantly and safely organised, everyone was cheerful and efficient. Thank you to the whole team!

title: Over 65 â€˜flu vaccination
body: I was very impressed with the whole operation. Staff were very clear with instructions and had organised a one-way system through the building. I was in and out of the place in three minutes.

author: CWP
title: Gastroscopy, Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy, Fife
body: I attended the gastroeterology clinic for a gastroscopy. I opted for Xylocaine premed. I felt that it had little effect and indicated this to the endoscopist as soon as she started the procedure. Almost immediate intense choking and gagging resulted in the scope having to be removed. I took some time to recover. No additional premed analgesic or sedative was offered, and the procedure was resumed. Again, intense choking and gagging, as well as sever bloating caused by the injected air resulted in the scope having to be removed before the examination could be completed. The only words that I can use to describe how it felt are that it was like extreme torture, and left me with an aching throat for several days.

title: Good guidelines
body: Was so organised. I have frequented this practice quite a few times during my life, and was great to see it opened up with perfect instructions due to COVID. One way in, another way out. They have done really well (as expected).

author: DMK
title: Day Surgery Unit Queen Margaret Hospital
body:
I had surgery on my hand.  
I was a bit apprehensive but shouldnâ€™t have worried as the care I received was exceptional.

title: flu jab
body: had a time slot for the flu jab and ther was a very very long que was outside in que in the rain for an hour yet everyone was happy and waiting and once got ther the staff wer amazing and very safe with the covid once in was very quick and then out was all covid safe well done all alot of people turned up all at the begging of the time slot which was why the que so long but it ran smoothly and you all done amazing i and everyone i herd saying that they all felt safe

title: Excellent service
body: I was so impressed with my visit to the minor injuries unit today, everybody I met, from reception, the nurse and the xray department, was so helpful and professional. I could not have asked for better care, which is particularly commendable given the COVID measures they are working with. The nurse I saw was thorough and reassuring and deserves every credit.

readBy.name: Cambridgeshire And Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb service
body:
I had an over 65 flu jab. The process was absolutely magnificent. Just hope I donâ€™t catch flu.
Everything was brilliantly organised.

title: Wonderful service as always
body: I went for my annual Flu vaccination  on Sunday 27th Sept 2020! ! The staff were amazing! So polite and friendly! Very reassuring and efficient! The queues were  swiftly and efficiently dealt with and the whole experience was perfectly handled ! A BIG thank you to all the  Speedwell Practice, Torrington you are the a BEST!!

title: Good practice
body: Had flu injection 9th Sept and I thought the organisation was excellent and well carried out and the staff very professional

title: Great service
body: Since my recent diagnosis I have received regular contact as promised. My condition has been reviewed thoroughly and the staff have been polite and attentive. Given the stresses they are currently under they have not only coped with unprecedented times but they have actually improved. Well done and thank you.

title: Caring professional practice
body:
Friendly, caring , good listeners and take time to discuss and clarify health issues.
Busy practice, but they do not rush things
Always a good welcome I think the whole team have a real heart to provide care for people

title: Efficient service
body: Flu jab service was very  well organised. Also good to see my GP instead of being on the end of a phone!

title: decent practice
body: The flu jab process was excellent. The general support for my health has been personal and technically excellent. Organisation is occasionally chaotic

title: Very professional
body: Very professional service,friendly and helpful staff.nothing too much trouble.clean covid secure premises,would recommend this clinic.

title: Absolutely no complaints, all staff helpful andâ€¦
body: Luckily very healthy so rarely have to visit my Doctor, flu jab once a year and review of my prescription for HRT once a year . Just had my flu jab as nearing 76 probably amongst the first â€œ wave â€œ , well organised and ran like clockwork, brilliant . May I also add my thanks to you all for your continued care for us all during these strange and difficult times , youâ€™re all NHS heroes .

title: Good Service
body: Really well organised from start to finish. All of covid 19 guidelines had been adhered to. The only thing that possibly needs changing is to move the greeting station closer to the main door.

title: Great people and good care
body: I visited the A&E on Saturday in extreme abdominal pain and was sent to the EAU where all the people working their were really understanding and carried out the tests to help find the cause , everyone was very helpful, thank you

title: Rude staff
body: One of the receptionist was very rude to me on several occasions. April was the first time l visited trying to register. I know people are stressed about COVID19 but that doesn't give anyone any passport to speak to people like they are a piece of dirt.

title: Outstanding Practice
body: Just to let you all know what a fantastic job you are doing especially in these strange times. The staff are always extremely professional, courteous, thoughtful and helpful. Staff members have on numerous occasions have gone over and above their role to help. The G.P's and Nurses are supportive and caring, nothing appearing too much trouble and are always treated with dignity and respect. Confidentiality is always high priority within the practice. The new telephone system is great and Love the music on it.

title: Wear Trainers for your Appointment
body: I called the Practice a few times over the summer, and was unable to get an appointment. I guess due to covid they pulled the shutters down on consultations in person. However, I got an appointment to see a GP in person in September. I arrived 5mins before the appointment time as instructed - covid rules - and waited outside the reception.  The GP popped their head out of the door into the waiting area, shouted my name, then turned on a six pence and was off.  I assumed they wanted me to follow, but it wouldn't take much, surely, for them to say "follow me please".  I had to run after them, to try and find which room they'd gone to.  A ridiculous Benny Hill-esque scenario.  Luckily a door had been left open to one particular room, so I walked into that room, assuming it was right. The consultation was soulless and mechanical.  I was given the impression that I was taking up their time, because, you know, they've got patients to see. The irony was bizarre. People go to their GP for the personal touch, expecting them to talk to them and understand the issues they're facing. This was the antithesis of that. My recommendation would be to wear sports shoes and be fit if you have an appointment at this Practice because when you arrive your GP will pop out, ball your name, then run off to their room, no doubt moaning how you're eating into the time in their day. And if you want to find where they've gone, you need to be quick.

title: Flu jab
body: My husband and I had our flu jabs today it was so well organised, lovely Freindly staff we were very impressed

title: Excellent staff, knowledge and facilities
body: I was an inpatient for a week. I couldnâ€™t fault a thing. Staff of all levels were so caring, helpful and made being stuck in a room with no visitors very straightforward. I got a firm diagnosis. Everything was so well organised. Particularly like the my UCLH app to access letters, very useful for other doctors to see records quickly. Iâ€™d just like to say a massive thank you, the job you do is amazing, and I appreciate your help and support.

author: pegasuseq35
title: Life saving care
body: Suffered serious seizures that necessitated induced coma and ventilator. I have no doubt that BGH and paramedics saved me from probable life threatening outcome. Superb, professional, caring service by all involved in my recovery. ICU, Ward 5 staff were exceptional. Medical and ancillary staff were totally dedicated and discharge and follow up procedure was faultless. So very grateful.

author: Lolly72
title: My Breast Cancer Journey
body:
Unfortunately, I was diagnosed with breast cancer at the beginning of 2020 & underwent a lumpectomy, followed by Radiotherapy.  
Throughout the whole process, I have felt that the staff making appointments across all sites did not listen when I told them my personal circumstances and this meant I kept being given very early appointments that I just could not get to due to having a primary school age child.  
Staff repeatedly tried to use out of date contact details when trying to get in touch & I felt actually became a bit snippy with me about them having incorrect details, despite the fact that I had provided my current contact details on several occasions. If the internal systems do not get updated, this is not the fault of the patient.  
When trying to book my Radiotherapy, I was repeatedly asked to travel quite a distance from my home, in the height of the COVID19 pandemic, from an area with a very low infection rate, to an area with the highest rate in the county despite the treatment I required being readily available in my home town. In my opinion consideration was never given to the fact that as a single parent, I could not simply obtain childcare as we were in full lockdown and I was made to feel like the NHS targets were more of a priority to some staff than the welfare of the patient.  
During one visit to The Parapet, one of the specialists advised me to give up smoking & they're suggestion was that I go for a long walk & that this hopefully would help me give up - I felt this was a tad naive, unrealistic and frankly insensitive. This member of staff later insulted me by stating in a letter to my GP that I had taken my daughter along to my appointment - If they had read my notes, they would have been aware that I have a young son, not a 30 year old daughter as they had assumed because a friend came along to the appointment. I believe that a little more care, attention to detail & sensitivity is required by this member of staff.  
My biggest complaint about this whole process however is the fact that not one of the professionals I spoke to prior to my surgery explained that the incision would be made around the edge of my areola/nipple area. In all of the literature that I was given by the clinic, the diagrams showed an incision across the fleshy part of the breast & I was extremely anxious about removing the dressings several weeks after surgery as I did not know what to expect - This was not it. I was unable to attend face to face appointments due to the pandemic so feel that I had no practical or emotional support from professionals and when I did call the Breast Care Nurse office with my concerns, they seemed far too busy to talk with me, refused to arrange a district nurse visit and made me feel like I was a bit of an inconvenience. I now have a permanently deformed nipple where the stitching was carelessly done and I was not given any advance warning, nor any options regarding this procedure.  
Furthermore, on completion of the Radiotherapy, staff advised me that the skin around my breast may become dry & itchy during the treatment and for a few weeks afterwards. This was a complete under-statement. My nipple was essentially burnt to the extent that it went black, itched like crazy and all of the skin peeled off over the course of a couple of weeks, which was extremely uncomfortable, embarrassing and has in fact left me with blocked ducts and unsightly cysts all over my nipple that discharge white gunk. Given that I had ductal carcinoma, this has left me with more concerns about regrowth.  
I felt quite let down at times & strongly feel that staff should explain all of the gory details of the surgery & treatments to the patient - The lack of information caused me shock, anxiety, tears and much distress. If staff do not feel comfortable explaining these details in depth to patients, I would suggest that they need a new career because to be left not knowing vital details about your breast cancer treatment is absolutely dreadful and has a really negative effect on your already fragile mental health & general well-being.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Antoninus
title: Venesection Clinic
body: I have been attending this clinic weekly since February to give blood. All the nurses here are excellent at their tasks especially Cathy who usually treats me. She is a delight to be attended by, always cheery and very professional.

author: circinusgd97
title: the Patient comes first
body: All staff in the ward have been there for me. very clean ward and my dignity is their priority. The patient always comes first. the nurses have my thanks and gratitude. they do more than just a job.

author: Suecp35
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Where I am now
body:
When I first came to St Andrew's Northampton I was eager to be there as my previous hospital was not suitable for my autistic needs. The last place was good for general mental health.  
Progress was made and I am enjoying it despite the ongoing circumstances like lack of nursing staff as the numbers were whittled down.  
I am happy where I am, belong and it is working well for me

author: peatydriftwood
title: My brother
body:
My brother was admitted to of the Institute of Neurological Sciences at the QEU Hospital, Glasgow.  
He had emergency surgery to remove a brain tumour and then suffered complications.He has been in surgery , the ward and both ICU and HDU. Due to current restrictions we can't physically visit with him. Due to his illness and surgery he is unable to speak and can't coordinate his hands to hold the "Virtual Visiting" iPad.  
We feel in these circumstances digital visiting is completely inadequate. He cannot tell us if he is in distress, cannot call out for aid, cannot communicate whatsoever. We do not know if he understands where he is or what has happened to him. He has been in this position for a few weeks now and its causing distress.  
The hospital staff, surgeons, consultants, nurses, have all been wonderful, but the corona Virus visiting restrictions are a cruel punishment. For him and for us.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Office of Johann Lamont, MSP for Glasgow Pollok

author: Stokes1harley
title: Drug withdrawals
body:
Went to hospital because of withdrawals from using cannabis.  
I always felt safe with the staff even though I had dark thoughts and was paranoid

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: JTT
title: ECATT Assesments
body: My daughter had 3 telephone assessments with ECATT. Dr Sufraz was extremely thorough in getting all the background information to come to the correct diagnosis. He made us both feel at ease and we felt he was genuinely interested in getting the right diagnosis and making referrals to get her the help she needs to get well again.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: poor info
title: Pre assessment
body:
The booking team at Wishaw in my opinion are a disgrace. I was due to come for a scope, but first would require a covid 19 swab. First the team were abrupt uncaring and unprofessional. They provided quite a lot of information and when I asked for clarity, I felt like I was spoken down to. Anyway received a letter for the swab and my endoscope. Both appointment letters had incorrect information on them. With no instruction on what to do for the swab or for my endoscope.  
Arrived at Hairmyres for my swab the staff treated me with respect and care. The nurse tried to make calls on my behalf in order to gather the relevant information for me. They managed to get a hold of someone at Wishaw for me to speak to. Again in my view, Wishaw were of no help. The swab staff kept looking to help me and eventually got me all the information I needed.  
I was shocked that at my appointment I was told I would need to isolate after the swab before coming in for my endoscope. I was not informed about this from the booking team. This is vital information that must be given not wait until the day of the swab to then tell you.  
The Hairmyres staff went above and beyond but I personally can't say the same for the staff I was in contact with at Wishaw.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Pain of accessing GP Services
body: It is a sad case that the right hand does not know what the left hand is doing. Having complained in person and being told someone would get back to me , nobody bothers . As a diabetic recently wanted to book annual flu jab. Had to go through the pain of explaining to the receptionist that this is something I have done every year be it at the surgery or at the local chemist. Blood tests have the same issue. The clinical pharmacist does a phone consultancy but does not follow up as agreed . Again same story when you ring reception to find out. Text message receive that my blood tests were ready and to call the doctor to book an appointment . I called the surgery at 6 pm and was number one at 6:30 pm . By 7 pm I was still in the line . My call had not been answered. I called in to the surgery to find it and book an appointment . Your on line system does not work you are asked to call at 8am to book an appointment . Have you ever tried to book . By the time you get through it is around 8:45 and reception inform you that you should have called at 8 am. Do you have more than one line so we can get through!!!!!!

author: MD 1
title: A&E for knee injury
body:
My teenage son injured his left knee whilst playing football on Sunday. I drove him to to the Queen Elizabeth A&E department for assessment. On arrival it was clear that they had changed the process due to COVID 19, However , the process was straightforward.  
My son was seen by a nurse and physio and also had X-rays taken of his knee. They suspect he tore his ACL but would need an orthopaedic specialist to confirm this. The staff gave him a letter explaining that the Consultant would call in a few days. The staff also gave him an exercise sheet with some knee movement exercises he should do to keep the thing moving.  
All in all the service was excellent and despite my son being unaccompanied during the whole process (due to Covid) the staff made him very comfortable and fully explained the process and his injury.

author: Kat96
title: Maternity Care Experience
body:
I had a positive experience of maternity care in Paisley at the RAH. My named midwife was Amy who I saw at nearly all my appointments. Being a naturally shy and reserved person, I felt confident and comfortable to be able to ask questions about pregnancy and birth. Having continuity of care helped talking about bodily functions and answering the midwifeâ€™s questions about it which you normally would not talk about.  
I went in to labour on my due date and saw my midwife twice that day at the antenatal clinic and in the midwife unit when my waters had broken. While I was at the midwife unit, I had what felt like a long continuous contraction and Amy took me straight down in to triage. Amy had a calm and professional manner throughout.  
While I was in triage, I was found to be 4-5cm dilated so I went straight on to the labour ward. On the labour ward I had Debi as my midwife for the rest of my labour and the birth of my baby. Debi kept me informed throughout the labour about what she was doing, why she was doing it and gaining consent to do it. Debi was very attentive throughout labour, I expressed pain at one point as the baby had kicked quite hard and it caught me of guard even though I'd had an epidural and straight away, she was asking whatâ€™s wrong?  
Although I ended up having an emergency cesarean section it was still a pleasant experience. The anaesthetist explained what was happening and talked about having a spinal anaesthetic and the pros of that. My surgery was carried out by Dr Anderson and the theatre team all introduced themselves to me and my partner in theatre, so we knew who was in the room which was a pleasant touch. The doctor beside me told me what was going on in the surgery and confirmed my baby was a boy and the weight he thought he was roughly around while I was waiting for my baby to be passed to me. I didnâ€™t have any complications from the surgery apart from a bit of moderate bleeding in recovery which Dr Anderson quickly resolved.  
Our first home visit was by a midwife Iâ€™m sure was called Elizabeth and she spent a great deal of time with us helping me to hand expressed as baby stopped latching on to breast. Although breast feeding didnâ€™t go as planned , I did get a lot of support from Debi and the midwives and care assistants on the post-natal ward even though Iâ€™m sure they were busy, they made time to help me. Although baby never latched back on to breast, we combi fed for a little while using hand expression that Elizabeth showed to me and using an electric pump.  
Iâ€™d like to thank all the midwives, doctors and care assistants involved in our maternity care.  
I had my baby at the end of 2019 before COVID 19 arrived in Scotland.

author: krystos
title: lump between my shoulder blades
body:
due to covid restrictions, my GP has been dismissive of a growth on my back so when the pain became too much, i visited the minor injuries unit in gravesend.  
to put it simply, the team was brilliant! from arrival at the door to entry to triage then treatment, i can't say enough how efficient the team were. Trisha and Kate were the primary nurses - you are a credit to the NHS.  
God bless.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: I canâ€™t express enough how kind and caring the staff are at Murdishaw Health Centre,They are not just fantastic at what they do,they go about it in such a friendly manner ,very efficient,and what they say,they do! Thanks everyone

title: Exemplary Care
body:
As a family we are so grateful for our local Practice. We appreciate the patience, care, courtesy and expertise. If our GP's don't know then they access someone who does.
We've had experience of one of our family suffering cancer, along with the ups and downs, aches and pains of life. We have found it such a relief to know that from the most serious to the less serious good care has always been and remains a priority of this Practice.
Thank you to the GP's, Nurses, and helpful, friendly receptionists and medical secretary.
We have so much to be grateful for in this dedicated, local team.

author: fellow NHS worker
title: Fantastic Consultant
body: I want to give a shout out to Dr. Wallage at the Health Village, Frederick Street. She was amazing so friendly and calming. She explained everything she was doing and gave me reassurance all the way through the consultation. I work in the NHS myself and I appreciated her lovely manner and the HCA who was also present. They made what was a slightly uncomfortable procedure more relaxing.

author: LincolnshirePoacher
title: Why canâ€™t I see a doctor face to face?
body: My appointment was by telephone when I think it should be face to face. Why - if I can go to work, go for a drink, live a relatively normal life why canâ€™t I see a doctor face to face? Because itâ€™s easy to not do something rather than what I think is best for me as The Patient - the person who pays for the service.

author: firees55
title: First class support from Home First, Hawick
body: The superb team from Home First came in with care for my husband who has a terminal brain tumour and is now receiving palliative care. Every single carer has been professional, skilled and spent time getting to know us and understand our needs. They have cared for both of us in very challenging circumstances. This is an excellent support for families in similar situations.

title: Very helpful
body:
Well organised with a one way system, no queuing 
, the staff were very helpful with the situation to make sure you felt very safe

title: Receptionist triage system
body: Extremely difficult to get a phone appointment and the 'triage' system receptionists making medical decisions about whether a patient should have an appointment or not... This needs urgent reveiw

title: care for my father throughout his admisssion postâ€¦
body: I visited my father on 27/9/2020 in the acute medical ward. I was so thankful for everyone's dedication, understanding, and helpful care for my father. His diagnosis was explained, I was able to visit him during Covid19 and he continues to be cared for on the Neur rehab ward. Cannot thank you all enough

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Flu jab in the time of covid
body: Had my flu jab last week on a Sunday afternoon. Was very impressed with the organisation around social distancing and the speed of the whole process. Felt safe and the surgery team were really friendly and kind. It was a major logistical operation handled very professionally.

title: Great organised practice
body: Recently had flu jab and was very impressed by the organisation and care of the  staff who made the experience much less stressful in the time of corona virus.

author: lupusjt95
title: Visit to Minor Injuries
body: My husband and I visited A& E and Minor Injuries at the Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Glasgow. We were seen by a very nice nurse called Elaine who I thought went out of her way to help us. Being an elderly couple she gave us exceptionally good treatment and advice.

title: Have moved practice
body: Really disappointed. Wouldnâ€™t recommend this clinic having used it for a few years. Very cold reception and all my personal details and referrals sent to the wrong address despite telling the staff that was not address on many occasions. I have not been given important information about tests and very personal information opened by someone else. I have complained to the practice and they have ignored. I have moved Clinics now and so happy with the new practice. So much more professional and warm but suit trying to raise my concerns so it doesnâ€™t happen to other patients.

title: Friendly, helpful staff
body: We were invited for flu injections, had set time,it was very well organised and COVID secure with one way system and people taking temperatures and someone giving out hand sanitizer. Injection was swift and painless

author: Suffered
title: Franchised pharmacy
body: Why do you have a national health pharmacy and also a franchise pharmacy I gather all outpatients prescriptions are outsourced to a franchise company Which have an appalling reputation for keeping people waiting I had to wait 2 1/2 hours for my prescription and missed my transport home causing me a further delay of another 1 1/2 hours in future I will insist On on receiving an NHS prescription which I believe which I believe is green in colour whereas the franchised pharmacy is blue. In my opinion, another case of franchise businesses failing

links.id: ruined the good service i received earlier

title: Fantastic Practice
body: I have been with this practice for years. I always get extremely friendly and speedy response and advice. I highly recommend. They are always happy to help and easy to get in touch with. :) :)

title: great practice
body: Went with my wife for our flu jabs. We were apprehensive beacuse of the Covid situation. We were pleasantly surprised that at no time did we have to queue. The whole process was brilliantly organised and we were in and out of the building in less than 10 mins. Well done!

title: phone lines
body: I work for the NHS and agree this is worrying times but on 2 occasions now I've tried to call on my days off to get an appointment starting from 8am to get through around about 10.30 to be told to ring back the next day and today to listen to the machine tell me im over 30 in the que I used to deal with my quirys on docly but now we can't do this.

title: Exceptional service
body: I had a fall and banged the side of my head.  Staff were really nice, very thorough and professional.  Seen to almost at once.  Have nothing but praise for them.

author: PatientMe
title: positive online consultation
body: Annie from genetic testing very friendly, helpful and clear in her explanations on the online consultation. I really appreciated how well she remembered my cancer case from years before. I really appreciated that she had taken the time to really review my notes. It also always makes a difference when you feel someone has a kind manner, hears you, seems to understand how you might feel about your case history, and who helps you to understand complex medical matters. Very positive experience, despite being online under new COVID19 regulations.

title: Excellent practice
body: The practice consistently provides a very high standard in all areas . The recent flu vaccine day was excellent. No queuing, plenty of people to direct us where to go . We were in and out in a few minutes. A very efficient way of doing it in large numbers . I would be interested in knowing how many people had the vaccine during each day . Thank you Marazion surgery staff .

title: Failure to give Covid test results in good time
body: The website said test results within2/3 days. But after 4 days pressed for result. Given lab report which showed result was available 2 days earlier and had not been notified to me. Considering the cost and need for urgent result this delay is unacceptable

author: Sammer
title: Customer Service
body: Just wanted to extend my gratitude to Kareen the Practice Manager for an exemplar service provided . She went the extra mile to address my request even though it was short notice. I just wanted to say a big thank you for your help. I appreciate you so much. Stay blessed!

title: Always helpful
body:
Very organised, made it easy for me, I was contacted by phone to say when was the best time to attend.
So considerate

title: Flu jab appointment
body:
Very smooth process. No waiting, one way system, temp taken & hands sanitised on entry. 
Flu jab given in doorway avoiding small space. Nurses friendly & very efficient. No pain !

title: Receptionists decide whether you need medicalâ€¦
body: Recorded message on their phone states "your NHS is still here for you, each request for contact will be assessed" yet when calling reception staff state that telephone consults are for "very sick patients only". Telephone queue can take up to 40mins, when you've been trying for days to get an appointment- to be told you aren't ill enough and phone consultations are urgent only is disgusting. Receptionists carrying out medical triage, I dread to think how many people haven't had investigations or treatment they need because of this setup.

title: Continuously disappointed
body: I've been with this surgery for several years now, always declining my prescription requests, rarely given a reason. I have been told by receptionist I'll just have to go without my meds! Not appropriate. My last experience trying to book my regular 3 monthly blood tests, to be told they do not do them after 4pm, but I work full-time until 5pm, so I have to go elsewhere that does..I also tried to book my flu jab, as I am classed as extremely vulnerable, but at the surgery they do not have them for under 65 years old, I would have to go to the other surgery, but guess what, no after 5pm appointments. I always feel like if you have conditions where you receive medication, you are assumed to not work. When will you accommodate the needs of all patients? Finally, I tried to log a complaint via your website, that too not available. Avoid this surgery of you can, I am going to enquire about moving to another one.

author: Mellissa
title: My birth story
body:
2 years ago I had my daughter in the community midwife led unit which was a fantastic experience. I felt completely in control and listened to in the time when I was most vulnerable, giving birth for the first time. I was able to use the birthing pool and the midwives set up an environment where I was able to relax as much as possible.  
I have just had my second baby at RAH, albeit during a pandemic. I arrived at 10pm. I cannot fault the midwives as they were great once again however I was supposed to be community midwife led again and was told during full blown labour that they were very busy and so had closed the cmu.  
Additionally to that my husband was not allowed past the front doors of the hospitals leaving me (a couple of hours from birth) to have to navigate up to cmu breathing through my contractions myself , to be turned away saying they're closed. I then had to get on the lift again myself to be told to go to triage and sit in a waiting area to be seen. Meanwhile I was using my breathing techniques that I had been taught and pacing as much as I could. I had to eventually ring the bell to be assessed as I knew birth was imminent.  
I was eventually taken to an assessment room where my husband was able to join me about 10.40pm. We were transferred to a labour suite when one became available about 11.20pm. I was not able to have the birthing pool I had wanted but they did try and keep it as 'green pathway' as possible by using the heartbeat doppler as opposed to the belly monitor. My second daughter was born a half hour later.  
It was definitely not the training experience it should have been however midwives did their best with the resources they had to make it as comfortable as possible.  
I cannot stress how important having the cmu open is. It is so important to allow women a choice on how they want to birth if it is medically possible.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Ria Pop
title: You were brilliant
body:
Had to to go to the Ultrasound and then onto Women's Health Ward at the Pilgrim.  
And not to put a finer point on it, I was very apprehensive. The team from the Ultrasound department and Women's Health Ward were fantastic. They were friendly, kind and caring. They talked to you and not at you and explained everything. Thank you Women's Health Ward you were brilliant!

title: Good practise flu jab procedures
body: Well organised and took every precaution to keep everyone safe. Glad to see elderly and most vunerable  seen quickly and not expected to queue. Warm and friendly approach to all. Some patients clearly anxious about having to leave home for the flu jab but reassured by staff
